asChild.description: Use the provided child element as the default rendered element, combining their props and behavior.

Use the provided child element as the default rendered element, combining their props and behavior.

escapeKeyDown.description: Function called when the escape key is pressed

focusOutside.description: Function called when the focus is moved outside the component

interactOutside.description: Function called when an interaction happens outside the component

openChange.description: Function to call when the dialog's open state changes

pointerDownOutside.description: Function called when the pointer is pressed down outside the component

requestDismiss.description: Function called when this layer is closed due to a parent layer being closed

update:open.description: The callback fired when the open state changes.

aria-label.description: Human readable label for the dialog, in event the dialog title is not rendered

closeOnEscape.description: Whether to close the dialog when the escape key is pressed

closeOnInteractOutside.description: Whether to close the dialog when the outside is clicked

defaultOpen.description:
The initial open state of the dialog when rendered.
Use when you don't need to control the open state of the dialog.

finalFocusEl.description: Element to receive focus when the dialog is closed

id.description: The unique identifier of the machine.

ids.type:
Partial<{
  trigger: string
  positioner: string
  backdrop: string
  content: string
  closeTrigger: string
  title: string
  description: string
}>
ids.description: The ids of the elements in the dialog. Useful for composition.

initialFocusEl.description: Element to receive focus when the dialog is opened

modal.description: Whether to prevent pointer interaction outside the element and hide all content below it

open.description: The controlled open state of the dialog

persistentElements.description:
Returns the persistent elements that:
- should not have pointer-events disabled
- should not trigger the dismiss event

preventScroll.description: Whether to prevent scrolling behind the dialog when it's opened

restoreFocus.description: Whether to restore focus to the element that had focus before the dialog was opened

trapFocus.description: Whether to trap focus inside the dialog when it's opened

asChild.description: Use the provided child element as the default rendered element, combining their props and behavior.
